actions: Clears Heat, resolves Fire toxicity and clears Damp-Heat from the Lower Jiao.
With Di Yu and Huang Qin, for bleeding Intestinal abscess or bleeding dysenteric disorder due to Damp-Warm febrile disease.
With Gan Cao, for toxic swellings and sores.
With Gan Cao and Xuan Shen, for sloughing ulcers from Heat toxicity.
with Huang Qi, for suppurating boils that have not ulcerated, or have ulcerated but are not discharging pus.
Tonifies, activates and harmonizes the Blood, moistens the Intestines, unblocks the bowels, reduces swelling, expels pus, generates flesh and alleviates pain.
With Jin Yin Hua, reduces obstruction and toxicity for swollen, painful sores and necrosis of surrounding tissue.
With Gan Cao, moderates spasms and relieves abdominal pain.
Cools the Blood, stops bleeding, clears Toxic Heat, astringes Fluids and generates flesh.
Clears Heat, cools the Blood, nourishes Yin, softens hardness, dissipates nodules, drains Fire and relieves toxicity.
With Jin Yin Huan and Dang Gui, for recalcitrant, ulcerated, and painful sores due to toxic obstruction leading to Blood Stasis.
With Jin Yin Hua and Gan Cao, for boils, carbuncles and furuncles.
Nourishes Stomach Yin, generates Fluids, moistens the Intestines, clears the Heart and eliminates irritability.

Moistens the Lungs, moderates spasms and alleviates pain, clears Heat and relieves Fire toxicity, moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels.
Strengthens the Spleen, resolves Dampness, clears Heat and expels pus.
Clears Heat, dries Dampness, drains Fire, detoxifies, cools the Blood and stops bleeding.
With Di Yu, for bloody stool due to Intestinal Wind.
Drains Excess Fire
Enriches Yin
Resolves toxicity

symptoms: Acute, intermittent, spasmodic lower abdominal pain
The pain is usually in the left or right iliac fossa
The pain may be quite severe and is worse with pressure
The abdominal muscles over the site of pain may be tight
The pain may have begun over the navel
Pain in the groin that is relieved by flexing the hip and knee and is aggravated by extending the hip
Qi Stagnation predominant: The pain may move around
Blood Stagnation predominant: The pain is fixed
manifestations.tongueCoat: Thin and white or Thin and yellow

conditions.name: Postpartum women with Damp and Blood stagnation

contraindications: Contraindicated for those without damage to Yin and Blood.
Contraindicated for late-stage appendicitis where Heat symptoms are not pronounced.

modifications.purpose: a stronger effect in reducing inflammation
